author: MathematicianLoud947
comment: Pay attention in class. Do your class work. Don't cheat your way out of assignments by asking friends how to do it. Put away your phone in class. Don't play games in class. Stay focused on your work. Ask your lecturer for help if you need it. Answer questions in class, even if you're not sure of the answer. Try to be more interested and see learning as actual fun, even though it can be hard and tiring. Don't say things like "I'm cooked," as if it's something cool. Language is important. You know what you have to do. It isn't hard to know where you're going wrong. You're an adult now. So just do it.
analysis:
```json
{
  "sentiment": "positive",
  "topics": ["academic"],
  "complaints": [],
  "suggestions": ["Pay attention in class", "Do class work", "Don't cheat", "Put away phone in class", "Don't play games in class", "Stay focused", "Ask lecturer for help", "Answer questions in class", "Try to be more interested in learning", "Use proper language"]
}
```

author: alts013
comment: Is your internship graded? That should be worth 4-5 modules worth of As. Your last chance to pull GPA up without mugging. But working life is a different kettle of fish for a lot of students because of the muscle memory of not waking up on time and taking MC.
